dcterms:title: Vascular senescence and leak are features of the early breakdown of the blood–brain barrier in Alzheimer’s disease models
dcterms:abstract: Alzheimer’s disease (AD) is an age-related disease, with loss of integrity of the blood–brain barrier (BBB) being an early feature. Cellular senescence is one of the reported nine hallmarks of aging. Here, we show for the first time the presence of senescent cells in the vasculature in AD patients and mouse models of AD.

fabio:hasPart.dcterms:title: Introduction
fabio:hasPart.fabio:hasContent: Alzheimer’s disease (AD) is an age-related neurodegenerative brain disease having the hallmarks of extracellular amyloid-β (Aβ) plaques, intracellular neurofibrillary tangles and neuroinflammation.

fabio:hasPart.dcterms:title: Discussion
fabio:hasPart.fabio:hasContent: Our study highlights the possibility that restoring the tight junctions and adherens junctions could represent a novel therapeutic paradigm in the treatment of AD.

cito:cites.dcterms:title: Amyloid-β and Senescence in Alzheimer's Disease
Emerging roles for the vascular system in neurodegenerative disease
